title: Barnaby Joyce & Pauline Hanson Explain Vision For One Nation's Future | 10 News+
description: Former deputy prime minister and Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce has confirmed he is joining Pauline Hanson’s One Nation. The pair announced the news on Tamworth’s local community radio, in Joyce’s electorate of New England, in New South Wales. The party switch comes after Joyce quit the Nationals a week and a half ago. title: Oscar Piastri Falls Short, Next Phase Of Gaza Peace Plan, Oprah Crashes Fan's Birthday | 10 News+
description: Former deputy prime minister and Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce has confirmed he is joining Pauline Hanson’s One Nation. The pair announced the news on Tamworth’s local community radio, in Joyce’s electorate of New England, in New South Wales. The party switch comes after Joyce quit the Nationals a week and a half ago.  ALDU has failed to phase out cage eggs in their stores by the end of 2025, which was the promised deadline the supermarket giant gave a decade ago. Angelina Popovski, who was just 14 years old in 2015, started the successful petition calling for ALDI to transition entirely to cage-free eggs. An ALDI spokesperson now claims the company will “complete the transition to 100% cage-free shell eggs by 2030”.  Oprah Winfrey has surprised a fan by crashing her birthday party. Clarissa Hill was celebrating turning 80, when the American talk show icon walked in with her wedding cake. The Brisbane woman joined 10 News+ to talk about her reaction to the special moment. title: 7.6-Magnitude Earthquake Triggers Tsunami In Japan | 10 News
description: Around 23 people are injured, one seriously, after a 7.6-magnitude earthquake shook three prefectures in Japan’s north-east on Monday night.  The quake began around 80 kilometres off the coast of the Aomori prefecture, where 90,000 residents have been advised to take shelter at evacuation shelters. The event also triggered alerts in the Hokkaido and Iwate prefectures.  A tsunami of about half a metre in height hit several coastal communities. Warnings for further tsunamis have since been downgraded, but authorities have warned the public of the possibility of a powerful earthquake hitting again within a week. title: Thailand-Cambodia Border Fighting Reignites As Air Strikes Test Ceasefire | 10 News
description: Fighting has resumed along the disputed Thailand–Cambodia border, with Thailand launching air strikes on what it says are Cambodian military positions as both sides trade blame.  Thailand launched several strikes after a Thai soldier was killed and four wounded in Ubon Ratchathani according to the Thai military.   Four Cambodian civilians have been killed and nine others injured.  The violence is the most serious test yet of a July ceasefire brokered by Donald Trump, with rocket fire, artillery and drone attacks reported across multiple border points.  Thailand says 380,000 people are being moved to shelters, while Cambodian authorities have ordered evacuations from northern border provinces. title: 100 Abducted Schoolchildren Freed In Nigeria | 10 News
description: One hundred schoolchildren were released on Monday after they were abducted from a Catholic school in central Nigeria.  It has not been revealed whether the release was secured via negotiation, force, or if a ransom was paid.  More than 300 children, with some as young as six, were kidnapped from St. Mary’s School in Papiri on November 21.  Authorities are working to free the remaining hostages. Meanwhile, the freed children will undergo medical checks before being reunited with their families. title: Josh Hazlewood Ruled Out of Ashes Series | 10 Sport
description: Josh Hazlewood says the achilles injury which has ruled him out of the entire Ashes series is "frustrating".  News today emerged that the quick would not be featuring for Australia against England after missing the First and Second tests through injury.  Hazlewood is now targeting the 2026 T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka.
